fields.description:
For example, the OVS kernel module comes from Midokura repo for RHEL/CentOS6 but it is upstream for RHEL/CentOS7 (VPC related)

[~tsugawa] please add details here - specifics would be preferable!
fields.summary: install midonet needs updates due to RHEL7

comments.body:
-Install Midokura on Eucalyptus- -> Install Midokura Enterprise MidoNet
(Midokura is the company behind MidoNet, which is the product, and not exactly "on Eucalyptus" - as the text says, it is to be used by Eucalyptus).

http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/install-guide/install_midokura_prereqs.html
needs to be updated to point to RHEL7 repos

Double check with current euca/mido cookbooks if all "yum" commands are correct.

Cassandra configuration for midolman uses mm-conf command instead of midolman.conf file

These updates are for the page: http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/index.html#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html

In section "Install the Midonet API on the Cloud Controller":

Change step 8 to:
Start tomcat:
{code:java}
systemctl start tomcat
systemctl enable tomcat
{code}

In section "Install Midolman on the Cloud Controller":

Change step 3 to:
Edit the /etc/midolman/midolman.conf file to set the zookeeper IP(s) (replace ZOOKEEPER_IP in the following example):
{code:java}
[zookeeper]
zookeeper_hosts = ZOOKEEPER_IP:2181
root_key = /midonet/v1
{code}

Change step 4 to:
Start midolman:

{code:java}
systemctl start midolman
systemctl enable midolman
{code}

Add NEW step 5:
Add cassandra IP(s) using mn-conf command (replace CASSANDRA_IP in the following example):
{code:java}
echo 'cassandra.servers : CASSANDRA_IP' | mn-conf set -t default
{code}


This is for the page: http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/index.html#install-guide/install_midokura_prereqs.html

In the section "Zookeeper":
Change the commands to:

{code:java}
yum install zookeeper
systemctl start zookeeper
systemctl enable zookeeper
{code}

I'll come up with more updates to the zookeeper and cassandra information for this page because they need to indicate that we don't recommend colocating these services with the cloud controller.

MidoNet, ZooKeeper, Cassandra, Tomcat, Midolman, Midokura - checked all TM names/spelling/caps
added ".service" to the systemd commands above (was already done)

NOTE that [~tsugawa] said mm.conf and [~mbacchi] said mn.conf - which is it?
IMPORTANT if you want to change zookeeper/cassandra and CC, let me know because it says this now:
The midonet-api must run co-located with the Eucalyptus Cloud Controller (CC) ... in the topology topic.
And install topic says to put the midonet api on the CC.

These sections updated with the above - please review - 
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura.html (and topics below)
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/preparing_vpc_midonet.html
Will appear in 10 PM doc build

Its mn-conf, the command I provided came directly from our cookbook, and is also mentioned in the Mido docs: http://docs.midokura.com/docs/v1.9/en/quick-start-guide/rhel-7_juno-osp/content/_midolman_installation.html

Regarding the midonet-api on the Cloud Controller, those pages you reference (topology topic) is incorrect when it abbreviates Cloud Controller as CC.  The Cloud Controller is commonly abbreviated as CLC, and the Cluster Controller is CC (as per http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/euca_components.html)  So that abbreviation should be changed from CC to CLC on that page.  Also on the install page maybe we should clarify with a correct abbreviation in the heading "Install the MidoNet API on the Cloud Controller" by adding "(CLC)" to the end so its obvious what we mean.  On the install topic I don't see any incorrect abbreviations or cloud controller references.

I've reviewed your changes above and they look good.

Yesterday afternoon [~tsugawa] mentioned that we were still missing a step in our midolman configuration (step 4.a from this guide: http://docs.midokura.com/docs/v1.9/en/quick-start-guide/rhel-7_juno-osp/content/_midolman_installation.html)  I am not asking you to wedge that in the install guide yet, I have to determine exactly which template we should recommend customers use.  TODO item for me.

It is mn-conf (sorry for the typo).

[~mbacchi] wrt template, all our tests were executed using "default" (which is compute.medium).
Everything works even in the scale system, so for small/medium deployments default should suffice.
For completeness, documentation could recommend gateway-large for gateways and compute-large for large deployments of Eucalyptus.
The main point of step 4.a. is to activate the Cassandra server configuration of step 3 on all hosts running midolman.

[~kmeredith]
My understanding of what "The MidoNet Gateway will take over which ever interface Eucalyptus GatewayInterface is configured for and block traffic that is not to/from MidoNet." is trying to/should convey is:

- The network interface(s) specified as "GatewayInterface" (in network.json configuration file) should be dedicated for Eucalyptus/MidoNet (for configuration/operation/use)
- Eucalyptus/MidoNet expects exclusive use of the network interface specified in "GatewayInterface"
- If the main network interface of a server is specified in GatewayInterface, most likely the connectivity to that server will be lost once Eucalyptus is deployed (as expanded in the sub bullet) 

-The following example shows a Eucalyptus network JSON file that is configured for MidoNet:- should be changed to The following Eucalyptus network JSON template file shows a sample VPCMIDO mode configuration

[~kmeredith] step 6 refers to the MidoNet documentation (http://docs.midonet.org/docs/latest/operations-guide/content/static_setup.html)

The URL should be replaced to
http://docs.midokura.com/docs/v1.9/en/operations-guide/content/static_setup.html

midonet.org/docs/latest is for the open source MidoNet (2 problems: 1. midonet.org latest is basically MidoNet 5.x, while Eucalyptus 4.3 only supports MidoNet 1.9; 2. midonet.org is the open source version, which is untested in Eucalyptus 4.3, so we should point to MEM 1.9 docs at midokura.com)

More feedback from [~tsugawa] - 

Install MidoNet for Eucalyptus (http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html)
"how to install Midokura" should be "how to install MidoNet"
"Install Midolman on the Cloud Controller" should be "Install Midolman on Cloud Controller, Node Controllers, and MidoNet Gateway Nodes"
"To install the Midolman agent on the node controllers and user facing service:" should be "Midolman agent is required on the Cloud Controller, Node Controllers, and MidoNet Gateway nodes. To install Midolman agent:"
Gray boxes are missing for some yum commands.

[~mbacchi],
Could you please add the (optional) steps to reduce MidoNet logging (in tomcat setup)?
Also, we need to document that tomcat AJP (port 8009) needs to be disabled (nginx requires port 8009).
[~mbacchi] can you please give me the steps [~tsugawa] mentioned above? All other work has been completed on this ticket. (Feel free to verify that I got it correct) thanks!

Updates with 3 new changes after 6 PM doc build today
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html
